title: German submarine U-1208
text:
German submarine "U-1208" was a <a href="German%20Type%20VIIC%20submarine">Type VIIC</a> <a href="U-boat">U-boat</a> built for <a href="Nazi%20Germany">Nazi Germany</a>'s "<a href="Kriegsmarine">Kriegsmarine</a>" for service during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>.
She was <a href="Keel%20laying">laid down</a> on 30 June 1943 by <a href="Schichau-Werke">Schichau-Werke</a>, <a href="Danzig">Danzig</a> as yard number 1578, <a href="Ceremonial%20ship%20launching">launched</a> on 13 January 1944 and <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commissioned</a> on 6 April 1944 under "<a href="Korvettenkapit%C3%A4n">Korvettenkapitän</a>" Georg Hagene.
Design.
<a href="German%20Type%20VII%20submarine%23Type%20VIIC">German Type VIIC submarines</a> were preceded by the shorter <a href="German%20Type%20VII%20submarine%23Type%20VIIB">Type VIIB submarines</a>. "U-1208" had a displacement of when at the surface and while submerged. She had a total length of , a <a href="pressure%20hull">pressure hull</a> length of , a <a href="beam%20%28nautical%29">beam</a> of , a height of , and a <a href="draught%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The submarine was powered by two <a href="Germaniawerft">Germaniawerft</a> F46 four-stroke, six-cylinder <a href="supercharged">supercharged</a> <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a>s producing a total of for use while surfaced, two <a href="AEG">AEG</a> GU 460/8–27 <a href="Motor%E2%80%93generator">double-acting electric motors</a> producing a total of for use while submerged. She had two shafts and two <a href="propeller">propeller</a>s. The boat was capable of operating at depths of up to .
The submarine had a maximum surface speed of and a maximum submerged speed of . When submerged, the boat could operate for at ; when surfaced, she could travel at . "U-1208" was fitted with five <a href="torpedo%20tube">torpedo tube</a>s (four fitted at the bow and one at the stern), fourteen <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a>es, one <a href="8.8%20cm%20SK%20C/35%20naval%20gun">SK C/35 naval gun</a>, (220 rounds), one <a href="3.7%20cm%20Flak%2018/36/37/43">Flak M42</a> and two twin <a href="2%20cm%20FlaK%2030">C/30</a> anti-aircraft guns. The boat had a <a href="Ship%27s%20company">complement</a> of between forty-four and sixty.
Service history.
The boat's career began with training at <a href="8th%20U-boat%20Flotilla">8th U-boat Flotilla</a> on 6 April 1944, followed by active service on 1 January 1945 as part of the <a href="11th%20U-boat%20Flotilla">11th Flotilla</a> for the remainder of her short service.
In one patrol she sank one merchant ship, for a total of .
Wolfpacks.
"U-1208" took part in no <a href="Wolfpack%20%28naval%20tactic%29">wolfpack</a>s.
Fate.
"U-1208" was sunk on 24 February 1945 in the <a href="English%20Channel">English Channel</a> in position , by depth charges from Royal Navy frigates and . All hands were lost.
